subject: Re: JSObject
msgSnippet: Ah...let s see....(writing from memory as the code is at home and I m at work)... All I know currently is that I need to place a certain object into a
messageBody:
Ah...let's see....(writing from memory as the code is at home and I'm
at work)...

All I know currently is that I need to place a certain object into a
JSObject, the pass this JSObject to my class (so it can then pull it
out and do what it needs to do). I believe the class I'm trying to
test will be extending Applet, if that helps. As far as which
JavaScript environment...not sure I understand what you mean by that,
but I'll probably be targeting IE 5.5+ and NS 6.0+ as far as browser
compatibility goes.

As to which JSUnit I downloaded...I didn't know there were that
many...I'll have to go take a look at them. :)

Thanks,

-Eric

--- In junit@y..., "Schaible, Jorg" <joerg.schaible@g...> wrote:
> Hi Eric,
>
> > Has anyone written unit tests trying to use the
> > netscape.javascript.JSObject? I've been poking around, but
haven't
> > found a good way to create one containing the values I want. Of
> > course they would just *HAVE* to make it final, so I couldn't
extend
> > it. :p
> >
> > I have downloaded the latest JSUnit, so if that's the route I
will
> > have to take, just let me know. And, if you've used JSUnit to
write
> > tests for a class using JSObject, please drop me some hints. :)
>
> Can you describe exactly what you want to test and which JavaScript
> environment you use? Also *which* JsUnit did you consider?
Xprogramming.com
> lists 4 different.
>
> Regards,
> Jorg
